conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and effect of light source position.
Four objects: egg, apple, baseball, microphone; each casts a shadow labeled A, B, C, D.
Shadows are directly below objects, indicating light source is directly above.
Light source moving to the right changes direction of light rays.
Shadows will shift to the left as light source moves to the right.
Shadow size changes based on light ray angle; may elongate horizontally.
Egg's shadow (A) moves left and may elongate horizontally.
Apple's shadow (B) moves left and may elongate horizontally.
Baseball's shadow (C) moves left and may elongate horizontally.
Microphone's shadow (D) moves left and may elongate horizontally.
All shadows shift left and may elongate horizontally as light source moves right.
